description: DatadogPodAutoscaler is the Schema for the datadogpodautoscalers API

apiVersion.description:
APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object.
Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and
may reject unrecognized values.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description:
Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents.
Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to.
Cannot be updated.
In CamelCase.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: DatadogPodAutoscalerSpec defines the desired state of DatadogPodAutoscaler

applyPolicy.description: ApplyPolicy defines how recommendations should be applied.

mode.description:
Mode determines recommendations that should be applied by the controller:
- Apply: Apply all recommendations.
- Preview: Recommendations are received and visible through .Status, but the controller does not apply them.
It's also possible to selectively deactivate upscale, downscale or update actions thanks to the `ScaleUp`, `ScaleDown` and `Update` fields.

scaleDown.description: ScaleDown defines the policy to scale down the target resource.

rules.description:
Rules is a list of potential scaling polices which can be used during scaling.
At least one policy must be specified, otherwise the DatadogPodAutoscalerScalingPolicy will be discarded as invalid

items.description: DatadogPodAutoscalerScalingRule defines rules for horizontal scaling that should be true for a certain amount of time.

periodSeconds.description:
PeriodSeconds specifies the window of time for which the policy should hold true.
PeriodSeconds must be greater than zero and less than or equal to 1800 (30 min).

type.description: Type is used to specify the scaling policy.

value.description:
Value contains the amount of change which is permitted by the policy.
Setting it to 0 will prevent any scaling in this direction.

stabilizationWindowSeconds.description:
StabilizationWindowSeconds is the number of seconds the controller should lookback at previous recommendations
before deciding to apply a new one. Defaults to 0.

strategy.description:
Strategy is used to specify which policy should be used.
If not set, the default value Max is used.

scaleUp.description: ScaleUp defines the policy to scale up the target resource.

rules.description:
Rules is a list of potential scaling polices which can be used during scaling.
At least one policy must be specified, otherwise the DatadogPodAutoscalerScalingPolicy will be discarded as invalid

items.description: DatadogPodAutoscalerScalingRule defines rules for horizontal scaling that should be true for a certain amount of time.

periodSeconds.description:
PeriodSeconds specifies the window of time for which the policy should hold true.
PeriodSeconds must be greater than zero and less than or equal to 1800 (30 min).

type.description: Type is used to specify the scaling policy.

value.description:
Value contains the amount of change which is permitted by the policy.
Setting it to 0 will prevent any scaling in this direction.

before deciding to apply a new one. Defaults to 0.

strategy.description:
Strategy is used to specify which policy should be used.
If not set, the default value Max is used.

update.description: Update defines the policy for updating the target resource.

strategy.description: Strategy defines the mode of the update policy.

constraints.description: Constraints defines constraints that should always be respected.

containers.description: Containers defines constraints for the containers.

items.description:
DatadogPodAutoscalerContainerConstraints defines constraints that should always be respected for a container.
If no constraints are set, it enables resource scaling for all containers without any constraints.

enabled.description: Enabled, if false, allows one to disable resource autoscaling for the container. Defaults to true.

name.description: Name is the name of the container. Can be "*" to apply to all containers.

requests.description: Requests defines the constraints for the requests of the container.

maxAllowed.description: MaxAllowed is the upper limit for the requests of the container.

minAllowed.description: MinAllowed is the lower limit for the requests of the container.

maxReplicas.description: MaxReplicas is the upper limit for the number of POD replicas. Needs to be >= minReplicas.

minReplicas.description: MinReplicas is the lower limit for the number of pod replicas. Needs to be >= 1. Defaults to 1.

objectives.description:
Objectives are the objectives to reach and maintain for the target resource.
Default to a single objective to maintain 80% POD CPU utilization.

items.description: DatadogPodAutoscalerObjective defines the objectives to reach and maintain for the target workload.

containerResource.description: ContainerResource allows to set a container-level resource objective.

container.description: Container is the name of the container.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource.

value.description: Value is the value of the objective

type.description: Type specifies how the value is expressed (possible values: Utilization).

utilization.description: Utilization defines a percentage of the target compared to requested workload

podResource.description: PodResource allows to set a pod-level resource objective.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource.

value.description: Value is the value of the objective.

type.description: Type specifies how the value is expressed (possible values: Utilization).

utilization.description: Utilization defines a percentage of the target compared to requested workload

type.description: Type sets the type of the objective.

owner.description:
Owner defines the source of truth for this object (local or remote).
Value must be set when a DatadogPodAutoscaler object is created.

remoteVersion.description:
RemoteVersion is the version of the .Spec currently stored in this object.
This is only set if the owner is Remote.

targetRef.description: TargetRef is the reference to the resource to scale.

apiVersion.description: apiVersion is the API version of the referent

kind.description: kind is the kind of the referent; More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

name.description: name is the name of the referent; More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

status.description: DatadogPodAutoscalerStatus defines the observed state of DatadogPodAutoscaler

conditions.description: Conditions describe the current state of the DatadogPodAutoscaler operations.

items.description: DatadogPodAutoscalerCondition describes the state of DatadogPodAutoscaler.

lastTransitionTime.description: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

message.description: A human readable message indicating details about the transition.

reason.description: The reason for the condition's last transition.

status.description: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

type.description: DatadogPodAutoscalerConditionType is the type of DatadogPodAutoscaler condition.

currentReplicas.description: CurrentReplicas is the current number of pods for the targetRef observed by the controller.

horizontal.description: Horizontal is the status of the horizontal scaling, if activated.

lastActions.description: LastActions are the last successful actions done by the controller

items.description: DatadogPodAutoscalerHorizontalAction represents a horizontal action done by the controller

limitedReason.description: LimitedReason is the reason why the action was limited (that is ToReplicas != RecommendedReplicas)

recommendedReplicas.description: RecommendedReplicas is the original number of replicas recommended by Datadog

replicas.description: FromReplicas is the number of replicas before the action

time.description: Time is the timestamp of the action

toReplicas.description: ToReplicas is the effective number of replicas after the action

target.description: Target is the current target of the horizontal scaling

desiredReplicas.description: Replicas is the desired number of replicas for the workload

generatedAt.description: GeneratedAt is the timestamp at which the recommendation was generated

source.description: Source is the source of the value used to scale the target workload

vertical.description: Vertical is the status of the vertical scaling, if activated.

lastAction.description: LastAction is the last successful action done by the controller

time.description: Time is the timestamp of the action

type.description: Type is the type of action

version.description: Version is the version of the recommendation used for the action

target.description: Target is the current target of the vertical scaling

desiredResources.description: DesiredResources is the desired resources for containers

limits.description: Limits describes the maximum amount of compute resources allowed.

name.description: Name is the name of the container

requests.description: Requests describes the requested amount of compute resources.

generatedAt.description: GeneratedAt is the timestamp at which the recommendation was generated

podCPURequest.description: PodCPURequest is the sum of CPU requests for all containers (used for display)

podMemoryRequest.description: PodMemoryRequest is the sum of memory requests for all containers (used for display)

scaled.description: Scaled is the current number of pods having desired resources

source.description: Source is the source of the value used to scale the target resource

version.description: Version is the current version of the received recommendation
